title: Myanmar Unrest May Be Driving Regional Meth Surge, U.N. Drug Agency Says
sub_head: Warning comes after authorities in Laos seized a record haul of methamphetamine
body:
SINGAPORE—The United Nations’ drug agency warned that political unrest in Myanmar may be driving a surge in production of methamphetamine, as authorities in neighboring Laos carried out Asia’s largest known drug-trafficking bust.
Lao police on Wednesday intercepted a truck carrying more than 55 million methamphetamine pills and about 1.5 tons of crystal meth, according to photographs supplied to the U.N.’s Office on Drugs and Crime by officials in the Southeast Asian nation.
